content: Oh hey friends you know here at the craft
we've done all kinds of fire light sources we've done braised ears and
torches but we've never really done magical light sources so I thought today
we could do a magical light source so here at the table we have a 2/3 of an
inch washer on a couple beads those are going to make the base and I'm going to
glue those together with my craft goop then here I have a crystal bead and a
fitting with a nail that I'm going to use to attach it to the base but first I
need to paint the fitting and the base flat black so now that I've got that
painted black I'm going to paint it up with a platinum color and this is an
interesting metallic color I didn't want to use gunmetal I want to use some other
kind of metallic color so I used that and now that I've got that painted up I
can attach the top because I didn't want to paint the crystal I don't want to
cover it up with the flat black so I'm putting that on last and I'm just going
to put some goop in the top secure the nail through the center of the bees and
there we go we've got a really nice magical light source now here we go at
the table you can see there's a really nice company meant to this area and I'm
gonna give you a closer look you can see the bead is really nice that fitting on
the top really looks like it integrates and fits well with the project and I
really like the platinum color that I colored it it gives it a strange
metallic look and the washer gives it a lot of weight on the bottom so that
keeps it standing up nicely so there you go easy to do magical light source hey
you yeah you back here huh I know it was short what do you expect there's a short
tip watching longer episodes if you want Jesus quit bugging me hey and make sure
you join the forum - oh yeah and have a magical craft tastic day
you hey wizard how do you turn this off Oh
like that
